creator: robert@wittams.com
text:
getBBox() on an SVGLocatable will get the bounding box in terms of the top level <svg> elements 
coordinates.  
 
It should get it in terms of its nearest enclosing <svg> - the current user space.  
 
 http://www.w3.org/TR/1999/WD-SVG-19991203/struct.html 
 
see getBBox. 
 
This behaviour is shared by Adobe SVG Viewer 3, but the v6 preview performs as I have described.  
 
Are there lots of files that rely on the broken behaviour? They will all probably be updated anyway, unless 
Adobe reverts this change. Currently I am checking for ASV6, and wrapping this.

I believe it returns the bounding box in terms of the
elements local coordinate system (as per the spec).  
Can you provide an example SVG file that shows this is not the case?
If so please add it as an attachment to this bug (if you
paste it in the comments line wrapping tends to destroy the SVG).
